refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the lengths of the columns of the current row in the result set

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The mysqli_fetch_lengths function returns an array containing the lengths of every column of the current row within the result set represented by the result parameter. If successful, a numerically indexed array representing the lengths of each column is returned or &false; on failure.

refsect1.title: Return values
refsect1.para: An array of integers representing the size of each column (not including any terminating null characters). &false; if an error occurred.
mysql_fetch_lengths is valid only for the current row of the result set. It returns &false; if you call it before calling mysql_fetch_row/array/object or after retrieving all rows in the result.
